args: Sire, I've received word from Patia\nthat the imperial army makes ready\nto assault the Halidom.
And further, the invasion force is none\nother than the Black Raven Corps,\nled by Harle.
These are no ordinary opponents.\nWe'll need to be amply prepared.
Summon everyone at once.\nIt's time for a strategy session.

The Black Ravens advance from woods
to the south and mountains to the west.
It's likely they hope to catch us in a
classic pincer assault.
And to make it worse, they got\nmore bodies and gear than us.
Being forced to split our forces\nwould put us at a disadvantage.
Couldn't we cut down the western bridge \nand just worry about protecting the south?
No. We must place our attention\non the eastern woods.
Uh, the east? But there's no way to\nreach the Halidom from that direction.
If they lack a path, they will make one;\nHarle excels in attacking opponents\nin ways they least expect.
He will predict our strategy of dropping\nthe bridge and not advance from the\nwest OR south.

Begging your pardon, Captain, but our
scouts report their forces in the west
and south. There's not a single imperial
dog anywhere near the east.
Their forces will mobilize in the east\nunder cover of night.
They've intentionally let us learn their\nbattle plan in order to turn our own\npreparations against us.
Ah, but you're a keen one, Captain!
Right. In that case, I'll take the front\nline and lead everyone to—
No. The White Sparrows will take the fore.
I would ask you and the others to remain\nhere and solidify the Halidom's defenses.
I'm not sending you out there\nto fight in my place!
I've heard plenty about the strength of the\nBlack Raven Corps—the White Sparrows\nshouldn't take them on alone!

I know well Harle's particular brand of
cunning. I believe I can predict what
he will do and think of ample ways to
outsmart him at his own game.
We cannot permit the Halidom to fall,\nYour Highness. You MUST safeguard it.
Then I entrust His Highness to you all.
We'll keep him safer'n a safe!\n...That's a thing, right?
(I knew we would face each other\nin battle one day, Harle...)
My, my. Already out of breath, are we?
Tsk! These foes are SO persistent.
Look out! A fiend's attacking in the\nspot Harle left unprotected!
Yes, that's it... Stay riiiight there\nso I can... HAAAAH!
Harle! How dare you use an ally as bait!
This is hardly the time for your moral\nsermonizing. Look behind you.
The result is all that matters—in all\nthings. Oh, and you can start thanking\nme whenever you like.
That's only a problem if you don't win.
Enough chatter! The battle isn't over!
Oh, very well. Let's get this over with.
...We managed to finish this without any\nneedless casualties. Now rest yourselves\nand prepare for the next sortie.

If you know what I'm going to say,
perhaps you should not put comrades
in harm's way in the first place.
Why would you DO such a thing?
Is it not obvious? To win. What else is\nthere we need concern ourselves with?
You're saying that if it means victory,\nyou're willing to resort to any means\nno matter how cowardly or despicable?
Victory at any cost is no victory at all!\nHave you no sense of knighthood?!
I do this BECAUSE I'm a knight.\nIt's our job to fight, which means\nit's our job to WIN.
And if victory cannot be achieved, is it not\nevery knight's dearest ambition to perish\nhonorably for the sake of liege and land?
Although I suppose there isn't really\nany liege TRULY worth serving...
Enlighten me, then! What manner of\nperson is a liege worth serving?
A wise sovereign who considers\nthe kingdom and serves her people.
In much the same way, our duty is to\nserve the kingdom and her people\nwhile protecting the royal family.

Oh, I have no idea. That's why I'm asking
you, the very model of knighthood.
But I can say one thing...
If there is no liege worth serving,\nI wonder if there is even a such a\nthing as true knighthood?
(Even back then, I couldn't read\nwhat he was thinking...)
Did you find your answer to that question\nin the Dyrenell Empire, Harle?
